column1: Expectations from Application Management have changed significantly in the few years as more and more
are embarking on cloud and digital transformation journeys while dealing with unprecedented business
talent crunch. Cost savings is no longer the only driver. NextGen application management is expected to
resiliency, agility and speed while delivering business outcomes without ripping and replacing everything

This survey provides a quick view of where your organization stands in terms of SRE maturity compared to the best in class using a few curated engineering metrics across 3 core dimensions including Design & Build, Service Management and Monitoring and Alerting. We can use insights from this survey to identify areas of improvement, set goals, identify initiatives, create a roadmap and execute systematically to achieve the
vision of Next Gen SRE for your application portfolio.
Enterprises should adopt right design practices and build processes to ensure that the apps being built adhere to the
quality standards set for the enterprise. These include engineering tools, assessments, planning checklists and so on.
It is necessary for enterprises to enhance their processes to better respond to the agile changes and disruptions identified through the continuous monitoring tools.
Ensuring availability, security and performance through predictive analytics is
critical for resilience and reliability of your enterprise application
Expectations from Responsible AI have changed significantly in the few years as more and more\
are embarking on cloud and digital transformation journeys while dealing with unprecedented business\
talent crunch. Cost savings is no longer the only driver. NextGen Responsible AI is expected to\
resiliency, agility and speed while delivering business outcomes without ripping and replacing everything\
starting over. This survey provides a quick view of where your organization stands in terms of application\
management maturity compared to the best in class using a few curated engineering metrics across 3 core\

including Transparency, Technical Robustness and Safety, Human Centric Value, Sustainability and Well being, and Governance and Risk Management. We can use insights from this survey to identify areas\
improvement, set goals, identify initiatives, create a roadmap and execute systematically to achieve the\

As the use of AI becomes more widespread, it is crucial to ensure that it is developed and used responsibly, taking into account its impact on both people and the planet.AI systems should be designed to be transparent and accountable. This means that the decision-making process of the AI should be explainable and understandable to humans\

It is essential to consider the economic implications of AI development and deployment. While AI has the potential to create new opportunities and drive economic growth, it also raises significant economic concerns.One of the most significant economic concerns associated with the use of AI is job displacement.\

Data privacy is a critical consideration in responsible AI development and deployment. AI systems rely on vast amounts of data to learn and make decisions, and it is essential to ensure that this data is handled with care and respect for individuals' privacy rights.AI systems should be designed with data protection in mind.\

AI models should be monitored and updated regularly to ensure that they continue to align with ethical and social considerations and that they are performing as expected. This includes monitoring for unintended consequences and making updates as necessary.\

</html>","168","NULL","NULL","2","Software Engineering","","Software engineering is an engineering-based approach to software development. Engineering techniques are used to inform the software development process, which involves the definition, implementation, assessment, measurement, management, change, and improvement of the software life cycle process itself. Fine-tuning of the engineering process is the key aspect of creation and maintenance of the applications.","false","0"
